security: Disclosing Morgan's potential persona non grata status with the FBI, his high-profile social circles, or his past dealings with the Agency's Central Cover operations could damage relationships. Specifically, referring to the rumor that "Morgan apparently proselyted a great number of Bureau Agents at higher salaries than the Bureau made and this made Director Hoover furious," or mentioning Lyon L. (Slug) Tyler's former association with Morgan's law firm, could reveal sensitive background information.
summary: A memorandum providing background information on Edward P. Morgan, detailing his career history, associations, and rumored conflicts with J. Edgar Hoover.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated May 4, 1967, provides background information on Edward P. Morgan, an individual associated with the Society of Former Agents of the FBI. The memo details Morgan's career, including his time in the FBI's Training Division, his success in Federal Communications law practice, and his role in the Office of Price Stabilization during the Korean War where he allegedly recruited FBI agents at higher salaries, leading to conflicts with J. Edgar Hoover; it also notes his high social circles and past association with Lyon L. Tyler, utilized by Central Cover.
title: MORGAN, Edward P.
